result.execSummary:
The defendant Thadius L Trimble was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

43

9:43 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

$150 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:48 a.m.

9:36 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - will not be getting an attorney and requests to talk with the District Attorney.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.  Court will set for status hearing on September 22, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.  Defendant to stop and make appointment with the DA's office. 

Court adjourned at 9:38 a.m.

Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Isaiah M.
